Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionAdverseEvent_SuspectEntity
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: The suspected agent causing the adverse event
element.definition: Describes the entity that is suspected to have caused the adverse event.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Refers to the specific entity that caused the adverse event
element.definition: Identifies the actual instance of what caused the adverse event.  May be a substance, medication, medication administration, medication statement or a device.
element.requirements:
Element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity.instance[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity.instance[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `AdverseEvent.suspectEntity.instance`, but has no comparisons.
